sentences.en: Can you contrive to be at the station by noon?
sentences.cn: 你能设法在中午前赶到车站 吗 ?

sentences.en: Can you contrive to be here a little earlier?
Folly and idleness often contrive to gratify pride at a cheaper rate.
sentences.cn: 愚蠢和懒散,经常在廉价方面得到自豪的满足.

sentences.en: Fortunate indeed are those who contrive to make themselves genuine book - lovers.
sentences.cn: 设法使自己真正喜欢读书的那些人确实是很幸运的.

sentences.en: Fortunate indeed are those who contrive to make themselves genuine booklovers.
sentences.cn: 那些努力培养自己真正热爱读书的人实在是幸福的.

sentences.en: How could you contrive to make such a mess of things?
sentences.cn: 你怎么把事情弄得一团糟 呢 ?

sentences.en: I must contrive a new career.
sentences.cn: 我必须给自己的前途想出个新的办法来.

sentences.en: I will contrive to be there by ten o'clock.
sentences.cn: 我会设法在10点前赶到那儿.

sentences.en: In 1862, a technique was contrived to take a series of photographs showing stages of movement.
sentences.cn: 1862年时发明了一种技术，可以拍出一连串展示连续动作的照片。

sentences.en: She finds it difficult to contrive now that prices are rising every month.
sentences.cn: 因为物价每月上涨,所以使她觉得难以持家.

sentences.en: She found it difficult to contrive when prices of everything went up.
sentences.cn: 百物涨价时,她觉得料理家务很难.

sentences.en: The couple contrive to bring up their children on a small income.
sentences.cn: 这对夫妻设法以菲薄的收入把孩子扶养成人.

sentences.en: The lawsuit says oil companies contrived the oil shortage in the 1970s.
sentences.cn: 诉讼中说，是石油公司策划了20世纪70年代的油荒。

sentences.en: Their naughty children always contrive to make such a mess of things.
sentences.cn: 他们家那些淘气的孩子们老是把家里弄得一团糟.

sentences.en: They, having first persuaded themselves, contrive to influence their neighbours.
sentences.cn: 他们首先自己信服了之后, 便设法诱使邻居

sentences.en: We therefore had to contrive a very large black-out curtain.
sentences.cn: 因此我们得制作一块很大的遮光窗帘。

sentences.en: When I feel wronged, I can contrive a hundred reasons against forgiveness.
sentences.cn: 我若被人冒犯, 可以设想上百个不饶恕对方的理由.

words.tran_cn: 人为的；做作的；不自然的
发明；发明物；想出的办法；计谋

trans.tran_en: to make or invent something in a skilful way, especially because you need it suddenly

trans.tran_cn: 谋划， 策划； 设法做到； 设计， 想出
trans.tran_en: to succeed in doing something in spite of difficulties
